metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the ind-def:environmentvariable58_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the ind-def:environmentvariable58_test and all of its valid operations.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the current process can be queried using a nil pid
A slightly more complex query which scans all processes and uses a regex on the variable name

environmentvariable58_test.comment: Test that the current process can be queried using a nil pid
A slightly more complex query which scans all processes and uses a regex on the variable name

environmentvariable58_object.comment: Get the home directory of the current process' user
environmentvariable58_object.name: HOMEPATH

environmentvariable58_object.comment: Get non-PATH env vars of a particular pid (32-bit)

oval-def:notes.oval-def:note: There's no fixed pid to use here... you'll have to pick your own pid of a 32-bit process.

environmentvariable58_object.name: PATH

environmentvariable58_object.comment: Get non-PATH env vars of a particular pid (64-bit)

oval-def:notes.oval-def:note: There's no fixed pid to use here... you'll have to pick your own pid of a 64-bit process.

environmentvariable58_object.name: PATH

environmentvariable58_object.comment: Get env vars of all processes which start with S

oval-def:notes.oval-def:note: pid 4 is unopenable on windows ("System" process), so using pid >= 0 would always result in an error. To prevent that, pid != 4 is used instead.

environmentvariable58_object.name: ^S
